questions.question: What is beamforming?
questions.explanation: Beamforming: focus signal. Direction: toward client. Benefit: range, speed increase. 802.11ac: standard feature. Power: efficient. Importance: signal optimization.

questions.question: What is MU-MIMO?
questions.explanation: MU-MIMO: serve multiple clients simultaneously. Benefit: efficiency, throughput. 802.11ac: optional. 802.11ax: required. Importance: performance improvement.

questions.question: What is OFDM?
questions.explanation: OFDM: modulation technique. Subcarriers: multiple frequencies. Benefit: efficiency, interference resistance. WiFi: standard modulation. Importance: technical foundation.

questions.question: What is modulation?
questions.explanation: Modulation: convert data to radio wave. Types: QPSK, 16-QAM, 64-QAM. Speed: higher QAM = faster. Distance: lower QAM = further. Importance: signal transmission.

questions.question: What is RSSI (Received Signal Strength Indicator)?
questions.explanation: RSSI: power level received. Unit: dBm. Range: -30 (strong) to -90 (weak). Threshold: below -70 poor. Tool: WiFi analyzer. Importance: signal quality.

questions.question: What is SNR (Signal-to-Noise Ratio)?
questions.explanation: SNR: signal quality metric. Unit: dB. Higher: better quality. Threshold: >30 dB good. Impact: throughput, speed. Importance: quality metric.

questions.question: What is packet aggregation?
questions.explanation: Aggregation: reduce overhead. Benefit: throughput improvement. Frames: combined transmission. 802.11n+: standard feature. Importance: efficiency.

questions.question: What is spectrum analyzer?
questions.explanation: Analyzer: examines spectrum. Purpose: interference detection, channel analysis. Tool: hardware or software. Usage: troubleshooting. Importance: diagnostic tool.

questions.question: What is site survey?
questions.explanation: Survey: analyze site. Purpose: AP placement planning. Data: coverage, interference. Tool: WiFi survey tools. Benefit: optimal deployment. Importance: planning step.

questions.question: What is heterogeneous networking?
questions.explanation: HetNet: WiFi + cellular combined. Benefit: best connectivity. Switching: automatic optimal. Challenge: management. Importance: modern architecture.
